item.text: Child Tax Credit Permanency Act of 2013 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the child tax credit, to: (1) make permanent the reduction (from $10,000 to $3,000) of the eligibility threshold for the refundable portion of such credit, and (2) require an annual inflation adjustment to the allowable amount of such credit (i.e., $1,000) after 2013.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.title: Child Tax Credit Permanency Act of 2013

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.title: Child Tax Credit Permanency Act of 2013
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend the lower threshold for the refundable portion of the child tax credit and to adjust the credit amount for inflation.
Child Tax Credit Permanency Act of 2013

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 159, Number 25 (Friday, February 15, 2013)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. DeLAURO:H.R. 769.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 and the Sixteenth Amendment[Page H597]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
